techmeme.title: LinkedIn confirms training its AI on user data by default, and says it is "making sure that those who have specific privacy preferences" can opt out (Joseph Cox/404 Media)
YouTube adds an Inspiration tab in the YouTube Studio app for creators to use AI to generate video concepts, create titles and thumbnails, and write videos (David Pierce/The Verge)
YouTube unveils Hype, a new promotional system inside of YouTube to help boost smaller creators; the most-hyped videos appear on a platform-wide leaderboard (David Pierce/The Verge)
YouTube integrates Google DeepMind's AI video generation model Veo into Shorts, letting creators generate high-quality backgrounds and six-second clips (Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch)
YouTube plans a major connected TV app revamp, with a new UI and features like immersive previews for creator pages and an updated subscribe functionality (Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter)
